comments.value:
Please can we amend the Cultural templates (landing, content and Festival templates) so that they feature a different global promo in the right hand column compared to the rest of the site? We need them to incorporate the attached graphic promoting Festival sign up.

Could this *possibly* be done tomorrow (Tues, 21 June)? For the time being I am updating the global promo across the site with the Festival sign up.

Another thought around this: instead of changing the way the global promo works, we could suppress the normal promo on these templates, and add in another feature box on the Culture templates which would allow us to put a promo there. Don't know if that is any easier?

Hi Morag,

Is this ticket covered by the change I made the global promo?
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/cultural-olympiad/film-and-digital/film-nation-shorts.php

Or would you rather the festival sign up link/promo only appeared (or appear in addition to the torch promo?) on pages in the culture section?

Thanks, Jamie!

Global promo looks great - thanks.

What we would like to do is to have the Festival promo appear in the Culture / Festival pages only, freeing up the global promo elsewhere on the site for the Torch nomination promo. The Culture / Festival pages would then only have the Festival promo, not the Torch promo. Is this possible?

I was thinking that it might be achievable by commenting out the global promo on the Culture / Festival pages and adding an extra, Festival sign-up promo. Is that feasible?

I just went to try to make it conditional and remembered what the issue is in adding conditional logic to that promo.

- the global include is pulled in at the template level
- the code inside the global include doesn't know anything about the page it is being pulled into, specifically what section it is in.

So to conditionally display another promo we'd need to update all the templates used by the Culture section, we'd then need to republish the Culture section (we can't just republish a single a single include like we do with tickets).

It's not that this is particularly technically difficult (equally it's not trivial), it's more that this will effect every page that uses the generic hub and generic content (and any other pages used by culture) and also require a republication of the culture section. 

[given we are meant to be in a code freeze it may not be the best time to do something this drastic !!]

Jamie

comments.value:
Sigh.

To coincide with the launch of the Festival site, the Culture team want to tweak their pages in this section: http://www.london2012.com/cultural-olympiad

They are thinking about swapping in a Culture logo to replace the normal Oly/Para logo top left, plus would like to replace the blue colour in the header bars and header text for pink. 

They would want it doing to go live on 21 June.

Please can you advise how feasible this is - and the time required to tweak these templates?

Thanks!

Hi Morag,

Assuming the new logo fits the ratio of the current logo (which is 166 x 188 -  obv we can resize but if the culture logo is wider or taller then we will have horizontal or vertical space) then that should take us to long to add in logic to change this over for the culture section and republish the appropriate pages, ie. less than 0.5 days
http://www.london2012.com/images/logos/logo-para.png

The header colour is much more tricky as we're currently using generic templates for Culture, which are all styled blue, so if we change it for culture we'll end up changing it everywhere else. To get round this we'd need a add a new class to every templates used by culture based on the section and then override all the CSS styles that cause the header bars / text to be pink / blue (including rollover states and accessible versions).

So yes we could do it, but it's not like changing a couple of CSS styles or picking a different colour in Photoshop.

When you say 'Pink header' are you referring to the bar that says 'The Games' ? I've make mocked this up in pink, see attached? and although I haven't fully though though what side effects this could have (ie. if we end up with pink headers on other pages by mistake!). This change is probably achievable by the 2st, the biggest amount of work here is probably making sure we don't' cause side effects (although we will also need to add a new class to all the templates in culture, add new styles, test that they don't cause bleed / side effects elsewhere and then republish everything. We may also need to use staging to make sure we don't end up with a mish-mash of pages with different colour bars in that section while we republish the pages).

In terms of "header text for pink" if you mean the dark grey text, you can sort of see the issues we'll hit here in the second screenshot (note breadcrumb and labels have also picked up the pink colour) that's not to say we couldn't work round this but it would be tricky to get this in place by the 21st.

So...

- Yes to logo (if it will fit, 166 x 188px, we can't adjust padding or vertical / horizontal height for the 21st) --> 0.5 days
- A reserved yes to the header --> 0.5 days (costly due to us having to update templates, separate out styles, testing, republish to staging etc. it's not just a single CSS change)
- No to any other text (for the 21st)

Jamie

Thanks, Jamie. I appreciate it’s far from desirable to make these changes, but I believe the Festival Director is being quite firm about this being required.

Can we go with the first two suggestions i.e.

1. change the logo – in fact there are two logos, one for the general Culture section, and one specifically for the Festival page. I will send these asap!

2. change the header bar to pink (as long as this doesn’t completely mess up all our other templates). In terms of the header text, I didn’t mean the pink text, but the blue header style when used for promos as shown below (Art, Digital etc.) Is that a big change too?

Grateful for your thoughts!


[cid:image001.png@01CC277D.49776B20]

Please find attached the new logos for these pages. There are two for different templates:

CO_166x188.png is the general Cultural Olympiad logo. These should go on all pages in the Cultural Olympiad section, bar the one mentioned below.  
festlogo.png is the Festival 2012 logo. This should go on this page only http://www.london2012.com/festival

The logos have been sized according to Jamie's request above, so fingers crossed they are okay. 

The other tweak we agreed (as above) is to change the header bar to pink, as per Jamie's mock up. Also - the team now want to have a pink angled shape in the top right hand corner, not an orange one as currently. Now there are various templates that do have a pink shape top right - is it a case of using a different template as the base one which gets tweaked, and us updating the templates used? Or can you swap in the pink shape into the existing template?

Please do let me know if you have questions, as I appreciate time is tight - we need this ready for Festival launch on Tuesday morning.

Thanks!

Hi Morag,

Although you are correct that we do have a version with a pink angle in the top right, the way this is assigned may mean we pick up other styles we don't want. Another real possibility is that although we can make say a generic hub page pink we hit all kinds of issue with another template that was really hardcoded to be blue, we may then end up with a mix of templates. It hard to give a firm answer till we try it, but if time is tight and we hit issues we may need to back out.

I think the key thing here, which may not be obvious to the culture team is this isn't a case of modifying a blue print brochure to be pink in photoshop or indesign. Instead there is lots of possible non intuitive logic deciding which templates get which styles and which styles pull in which images etc

Will try to do our best though

Jamie


Sent from my iPad

Hi Jamie

Thanks for this. And sorry to make your life even harder. ☹ They don’t have any idea of the complexity of changing templates.

Do what you can and if time doesn’t permit they just should have told us sooner...

Thanks!

Morag

comments.value:
Hi,

We've noticed an issue with the homepage promo which is causing the text to display incorrectly on the London 2012 site.

When we are putting together a homepage promo in CMS, obviously we have space restrictions on both the title and the text. Typically, the title can have three lines and the text five (although these are dependent on one another - e.g. if the title only takes up two lines, there can be six for the text). Obviously we work within these restrictions, ensuring the text fits in the box

However, sometimes in the process between publishing and the page reaching the live website, one of the lines of text in the title appears to slip down onto the next line, causing everything to move down by one line and the text to often be chopped off at the bottom. I suspect this is due to (very slight) differing boundaries in the relevant text box between CMS and the live site.

For example, in the picture below, when being put together in CMS the title fit onto two lines (One year to go to the/London 2012 Festival), freeing up another line for the text below. However, when this reached the live site, the title slipped to take up three lines (i.e. the 'the slipped from the first line to the second), knocking the bottom line of text out of the box.

Is there any way the parameters in CMS can be changed to reflect the actual boundaries on the live site? It's quite annoying when something looks fine in CMS, but then appears incorrect on the live site.

Thanks,

Michael

description:
Hi,

We've noticed an issue with the homepage promo which is causing the text to display incorrectly on the London 2012 site.

When we are putting together a homepage promo in CMS, obviously we have space restrictions on both the title and the text. Typically, the title can have three lines and the text five (although these are dependent on one another - e.g. if the title only takes up two lines, there can be six for the text). Obviously we work within these restrictions, ensuring the text fits in the box

However, sometimes in the process between publishing and the page reaching the live website, one of the lines of text in the title appears to slip down onto the next line, causing everything to move down by one line and the text to often be chopped off at the bottom. I suspect this is due to (very slight) differing boundaries in the relevant text box between CMS and the live site.

For example, in the picture below, when being put together in CMS the title fit onto two lines (One year to go to the/London 2012 Festival), freeing up another line for the text below. However, when this reached the live site, the title slipped to take up three lines (i.e. the 'the slipped from the first line to the second), knocking the bottom line of text out of the box.

Is there any way the parameters in CMS can be changed to reflect the actual boundaries on the live site? It's quite annoying when something looks fine in CMS, but then appears incorrect on the live site.

Thanks,

Michael

[cid:image001.png@01CC2FF3.9B474780]


Michael Thorne
Content Coordinator

e.g. Olafur Eliasson

Also, what are the rules for the ordering and appearance of projects in the Current list of projects.

Fixed and published..
http://festival2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/index.php

The order is 'reverse position' in other words it's ordered in reverse by position but with the events with no position at the top ie (null, null, 23, 22, 21.....2,1)

We can also order alphabetically, what we can't do is alphabetically order the events without a position and those with a position independently.

I did have a play with alphabetically ordering the two groups separately, but in one list, the biggest issue with that is that it's not clear to the user why there are two groups in alphabetical order (although TBH the current jumbled order, with events not appearing on the grid at the top, I also makes little sense to the user).

As a user the most sensible and the cleanest (to me anyway) would actually seem to be to order them all alphabetically, especially if I was looking for a event I had previously heard about on TV or the Radio. 

The fact that some are already shown on the grid seem irrelevant, it's like a festival program omitting events from the index because they appeared on the cover of the brochure or we're already featured in the brochure as 'highlights'.

Anyway, we can order it any which way, just need to know which one !!

:-)
I agree that alphabetical make most sense. Do it.
Now in alphabetical order
Jamie, not in alphabetical order any more?!

comments.value:
11am June 22nd.

This is an unusual one in that we will probably want to make the page editable so that ticket availability details can be updated throughout the day.
NB It is Friday, June 24. Please note this is confidential information.

Just to amplify this:

This is a huge moment for us – and is certainly going to be our heaviest day yet on the site as we will be signposting people to the Tickets site who come to us.

We need to have a splash page on london2012.com, to go live at 11am. We will wish to edit this during the day with details of changing availability / reasons for problems / links to further information. I am briefing this in to a designer – will aim to have this by first thing 22 June for implementation.

But given the volume and possible difficulties anticipated around the ticketing process, we need to be prepared to man the site over the following 48 hours too – the splash page will remain up for a few days.

While any problems would most likely arise on the Ticketing site, we might need to:
Amend the splash page at regular updates (we can probably do this by editing the html but if problems arise we might need support)
Keep an eye on traffic volumes on our site in case they reach dangerous levels
Ensure that functionality on our site continues to work given the high volumes

We would be very grateful if you could bear in mind this additional support level – obviously being out of normal hours we would expect any support to incur appropriate additional cost.
NB change to timings (confidential): likely now to be a 6am launch on 24 June.

comments.value: Amend the CMS such that it can use public-key ssh authentication in addition to the current password-based ssh authentication (so that we are not publishing to Akamai NetStorage via plain FTP).

Attaching proposal.
Russ, I believe you have already discussed this work with Jamie.
Can you add a not to this ticket letting us know whether it's ok for us to proceed with it please?
Many thanks,
Kieran
Still awaiting approval but very likely to be approved soon.
Approved. Set to high priority.

Thanks Danny – we are raising a PO for this with you.

Russ
Hi there - when is this planned to happen please.  Will need to test this out

Hi,
I am hoping to deploy the code to the live environment on Monday.
We can "switch it on" at any point after this.
NB Until we switch it on (by adding a newly-created private key), the code deployment will have no effect.
Once we have created the key, we will need to inform akamai of the value of our public key, and they will need to amend the netstorage account accordingly.
If FTP and SFTP can both be enabled at the same time, then there should not be any "downtime" (by which I mean "time during which publication doesn't work"). If FTP and SFTP are mutually exclusive then we will need to agree a window with the londonprepares team. As far as Kitsite are concerned we need about 10 minutes. Akamai might require longer (I am unsure of their change-deployment process).

Andy can you let me know when you would like to amend the Akamai NetStorage configuration such that it allows public-key authentication please?
The process is as follows:
 1. We create public/private key pair.
 2. We notify you/Akamai of the public component of the key.
 3. You/Akamai modify the NetStorage configuration to enforce SSH public-key authentication.
 4. ** At this point, publication of the learning legacy site will stop working
 5. We (Kitsite) will update the learninglegacy client, telling it the value of the private key.
 6. ** publication should start working.

Rollback procedure.
If - after step 5. - learninglegacy cannot log in to the NetStorage, we should simply undo steps 5 and 3.

Please can you let me know when would be a good time to do this please?

Thanks,
Kieran

Thanks - this is approved.

Thanks for putting this together for us Kitsite.

Russ

Hi Uzma,

In terms of adding the promo to other pages, it is not possible for you assign the whole 'module' yourself, we have to add it in the backend to each template. 1.       One is actually on the central 'event search' page.  Could you please change the link on the map to all events: http://www.london2012.com/map.php?center=55%2E61302%2C%2D4%2E33324&zoom=5&dtstart=2010%2D11&dtend=2011%2D07&types=webcam%2Cevent I think this has been hardcoded

2.       In the OW templates, we seem to have lost the news/photos/map/webcams links under the lefthand nav.  Could we please put that back?

Liz Goulding
Senior New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

comments.value:
I'll elaborate:

We're thinking of removing all dry content from the blogs section, to make the blogs more bloggy. We'd still like the content to come up as related blog stories (poss under diff title) http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/education/higher-education/index.php (example at bottom of page) but not feed through to the blog- basically migrate it somewhere else.

This would then archive the posts, and let people interested in the specifics -cycling from cycling page etc, drill down to the stuff they want.. if they wanted it, and free up blog for more entertaining stuff.

How easy would this be to do, how long would it take, and what problems do you forsee? Just looking for an idea of time/effort here.

Cheers
Zara

Zara Rabinowicz
Assistant New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Extension: 3137
www.london2012.com
www.facebook.com/london2012
www.twitter.com/london2012

Hi Zara,

Are you just saying you want to hide older blog posts from the blog navigation, but still have them pulled though on content pages? or do you want to be more selective about what is shown/not shown within the blog section? Possible via a 'show/hide from blog posts' checkbox that hide the posts on blog index page, but still allowed them to appear if linked to directly form a related page?

In terms of the pages still appearing as related content on other pages, if we left them where they we're but just updated the blog navigation (to hide them) nothing would need to change (on the pages pulling them in).

Going forward would you still be mixing 'dry' content with more 'fun' content within the blog section or is the plan to move 'dry' content to say news pages and keep blogs to the more lighthearted posts.

Jamie

Hi Jamie

We haven't really decided either way, just wanted an idea of how easy it would be to do, which you clarified ;.)

Will keep you posted when we makle any changes.

Cheers
Zara
